intro: Enkianthus cerasiflorus, commonly known as the cherry-flowered enkianthus, is a deciduous shrub native to East Asia. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, resembling cherry blossoms. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and produces small, edible berries in the fall. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. The leaves are elliptical and turn vibrant yellow in the autumn, adding to its seasonal appeal.
